intro: Payena rubropedicellata, commonly known as the red-stemmed payena, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of mostly flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The leaves are simple, opposite, and have a rough texture, contributing to its ecological role in supporting various insect and bird species.
